title: fix: update DEFAULT_CONTEXT_TOKENS to 1M for Opus 4.6
body:
## Summary - Update `DEFAULT_CONTEXT_TOKENS` from `200_000` to `1_000_000` to match Opus 4.6's 1M context window ## Context PR #9853 updated the default model to `claude-opus-4-6` but left `DEFAULT_CONTEXT_TOKENS` at the Opus 4.5 value (200K). As noted by @bchelli in [#9853 (comment)](https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/pull/9853#discussion_r2774901558), Opus 4.6 supports 1M tokens. `DEFAULT_CONTEXT_TOKENS` is used as a fallback across ~15 callsites (compaction, session sizing, memory flush, auto-reply, etc.) when the async model registry hasn't loaded yet. On cold start, Opus 4.6 sessions would be undersized to 200K instead of 1M. The OpenCode Zen model catalog (`opencode-zen-models.ts`) already had the correct `1000000` value â€” this brings `defaults.ts` in line. ## Test plan - [x] `pnpm build` passes - [x] `pnpm check` â€” 0 warnings, 0 errors - [x] `pnpm test` â€” 219 tests pass ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Summary

- Updates agent defaults to size Opus 4.6 sessions with a 1M-token fallback context window. - Improves `doctor` state integrity detection by resolving symlinks when searching for other `~/.openclaw` directories (avoids `/home` vs `/var/home` false positives on some Linux distros).

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is mostly safe to merge, but the doctor output can still be noisy/incorrect on symlinked homedirs due to an inconsistent comparison path. - Changes are small and targeted; the only functional concern found is a remaining `path.resolve` comparison that can still trigger the warning this PR is trying to avoid in some symlink scenarios. - src/commands/doctor-state-integrity.ts (4/5) You can add custom instructions or style guidelines for the agent [here](https://app.greptile.com/review/github)!
